Short answer: To maximize safety, Option 1 students will still begin school August 24 at Level 3 (A & B groups). The Board of Education will reassess the school plan level every 30 days.

Longer answer: The Hamilton County Level changed from red to orange (good progress), but we will continue to start school with a blended (AB days) schedule. Per our Board approved Back to School Plan: "Once the district is in a specific level (I.E. red), the district will stay at that level for one month from the date the level change was made by the Governor in reference to Hamilton County (if moving to a lower risk level). The change happens immediately if the level becomes more severe, (i.e. red to purple). For example, it would take on month to revert back to orange from a red situation. However, if moving from red to purple, the change is immediate."

post_text: The Mrs. Eads first grade students at Sharpsburg Primary were treated to a visit and book signing by author and illustrator, Loren Long. He was chosen by President Obama to illustrate his book dedicated to his daughters, Of Thee I Sing. He has several other works that he has authored and illustrated, including his series of Otis the tractor. Additionally, through donations, Mrs. Eads was able to secure enough funds to purchase one of the Otis books for each student - 52 in all! This is thanks to the PTO, Mr. Westendorf, some of her friends and family. Mr. Long signed and personalized all 52 books for the students!

Superintendent Dr. Kathy Sabo

It is with deep regret that we inform you about a recent loss to our school community. On October 5th, our superintendent, Dr. Kathy Sabo, passed away after her battle with cancer.
Dr. Sabo was so proud to serve in her hometown as the Superintendent of Norwood City School District. She loved this community and what was best for kids was at the heart of every decision she made. We share our deepest condolences with her family and with everyone who knew her.

post_text: Construction at Sharpsburg Primary is moving along! The work by Century Construction continues to be on schedule and progressing forward. New water piping has been installed, the new roof is nearing completion and the new transformers to power the new air conditioning/heater units has been completed by Duke Energy. The second floor of the primary is taking shape quite nicely with the installation of energy efficient lighting, along with installation of the ceiling framing and tiles. All ductwork is complete on the second floor and the painter is already on site, which is always a great sign of progress during any construction/remodel. Sharpsburg is grateful for the tremendous work occurring in the primary and very appreciative of everyone‚Äôs patience and understanding.
